turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: Doctor, I've been having shortness of breath and chest tightness for about three days, especially when climbing stairs.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Do you have any known medical conditions such as asthma, hypertension, or diabetes?

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: Yes, I have type 2 diabetes and high blood pressure. I'm currently taking metformin and amlodipine.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Noted. Do you have any allergies to medications like panadol or aspirin?

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: Yes, I'm allergic to panadol, but no issues with aspirin.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Any fever, cough, or chest pain at rest?

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_01
turns.text: No fever, no cough. The chest pain happens only during exertion, not while resting.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Based on your symptoms, a likely diagnosis is stable angina. I will prescribe nitroglycerin 0.4 mg sublingual tablets, to take one tablet as needed for chest pain. Please continue your current medications.

turns.speaker: SPEAKER_00
turns.text: Also, I want you to come back for a follow-up in two weeks. If your chest pain occurs at rest, lasts longer than 15 minutes, or is accompanied by sweating or severe breathlessness, go to the emergency department immediately.
